text:
Why a decision was made to have the following difference? (if there is a link to a relevant discussion could you please share - thank you!)
```julia> (a=1, b=missing) < (a=1,b=missing)
false

julia> (1, missing) < (1, missing)
missing```
but
```julia> (a=1, b=missing) == (a=1,b=missing)
missing

julia> (1, missing) == (1, missing)
missing```
CC <@U67431ELR>

elements.text: Why a decision was made to have the following difference? (if there is a link to a relevant discussion could you please share - thank you!)

julia> (a=1, b=missing) < (a=1,b=missing)
false

julia> (1, missing) < (1, missing)
missing

julia> (a=1, b=missing) == (a=1,b=missing)
missing

julia> (1, missing) == (1, missing)
missing

text: I'm afraid that's just a bug. :confused: I implemented the `Tuple` methods (maybe before `NamedTuple` existed), and `==(nt1::NamedTuple, nt2::NamedTuple)` happens to call `Tuple(nt1) == Tuple(nt2)`. But `<` calls `isless`.

elements.text: I'm afraid that's just a bug.

text: I assume the way to fix this is to implement `<` for `NamedTuple`?

elements.text: I assume the way to fix this is to implement

text: I guess. But it's worth checking whether there's already an issue about it. Not sure whether it would be OK to change this before 2.0.

elements.text: I guess. But it's worth checking whether there's already an issue about it. Not sure whether it would be OK to change this before 2.0.

text: Yes - probably it has to stay till 2.0. I could not find an issue or PR for this. I have opened <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/issues/40142>.
